goal_statement: Build a simple todo application for personal task management that helps individual users organize their daily tasks and track completion progress efficiently without complexity

success_criteria.criteria: Users can add and complete tasks easily without confusion
The interface should feel familiar and require no training or instructions for basic use
Users should be able to manage their daily tasks efficiently with this tool
Adding a new task requires only typing description and pressing enter
Marking tasks complete is a single click or tap operation

kpis.kpi: Task completion tracking - users can see completed vs remaining tasks
Cross-platform accessibility - works on desktop and mobile screens
Session persistence - tasks remembered between application sessions

constraints.constraint: No user accounts or login functionality required
Local storage only - no cloud synchronization
Web browser deployment only - no additional software installation
No internet connectivity required for operation
Explicitly excluded: task sharing, calendar integration, project management, categories, due dates, reminders

assumptions.assumption: Users are familiar with basic web application interfaces
Users have access to modern web browsers supporting local storage
Personal use context - single user per browser instance
Task descriptions can be adequately captured in simple text format

open_questions.question: What is the maximum number of tasks the system should handle efficiently?
Should there be a limit to task description length?
How long should completed tasks remain visible before archival?
What specific browser compatibility requirements exist?
Should the application handle data export/import scenarios?
